org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.ca.frg

Class IndexedFragmentDataStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.ca.frg.IndexedFragmentDataStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, FragmentDataStore, Frg2Visitor, DataStore<Fragment>, FileVisitor, TextFileVisitor, TraceDataStore<Fragment>

    public final class IndexedFragmentDataStore
extends Object
    IndexedFragmentDataStore is an implementation of FragmentDataStore that only stores an index containing file offsets to the various phd records contained inside the phdball file. This allows large files to provide random access without taking up much memory. The downside is each phd must be re-parsed each time.
    Author:
    dkatzel

      • idIterator

        public StreamingIterator<String> idIterator()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Create a new StreamingIterator which will iterate over the ids of all the records in this DataStore. The iteration order is guaranteed to match the iteration order by DataStore.iterator(). The StreamingIterator is only valid while this DataStore is open. If the StreamingIterator is still not finished iterating when this DataStore is closed via Closeable.close(), then any calls to StreamingIterator.hasNext() or StreamingIterator.next() will throw DataStoreClosedException.
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator instance; never null and never contain any null elements, but could be empty if DataStore.getNumberOfRecords() == 0.

        Specified by:
